item.title: One repository is not enough
item.description: Plakar offers a simple way to synchronize repositories across multiple locations. Two questions often arise: “Why do I need more than one copy?” and “How many copies should I have?” Why do I need more than one copy? If you store your data at a single location, you are at risk of losing everything if that storage fails. This can happen due to various reasons, such as: Hardware failure: The device’s components can fail due to wear and tear, overheating, or other issues. Power surges: Unexpected power surges can damage the device and corrupt the data. Natural disasters: Fires, floods, earthquakes, or other natural disasters can destroy the device and the data stored on it. Theft: The device can be stolen, and the data can be lost or compromised.
